I could maybe understand and could maybe enjoy flying ships from a console, but actually creating ships can be hard enough with a mouse and keyboard. I couldn't even imagine the frustration of trying to build complex ships with a console controller...

Some games belong on a PC for a reason IMO...
I think KPS suits more the WiiU... no... wait...

> 
> I think KPS suits more the WiiU... no... wait...

Can you imagine KSP on a Wii board?

Frankly, I can't see KSP being as immensely popular on PS4 as it is on PC. Because of mods. Mods are blood and bones of KSP - heck, last several major updates were basically mods added to the stock game. Skyrim was released six months after KSP's first public release (2011) and it's still popular enough that Valve made that dumb "pay for mods" move! Compare that with its current rankings on consoles.

To be short, it's a nice marketing move, but it won't make any differences in terms of KSP's popularity.

> 
> I think we'd all welcome hearing their thoughts on the current state of play then ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> Something along the lines of "we agreed that 1.0.2 drag was too high and heat too low and this is looking like a better balance for both" or "we're not seeing jet contracts we can't complete with the available parts anymore" would do a lot to assuage the concerns of the community ^^

[Mu made some comments about patch progress](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123613-Squadcast-Summary-%282015-05-30%29-Mu-Joins-In%21) in his joint appearance with Maxmaps on Squadcast, May 30. Also, check my sig for the lengthy "Squad HQ" SQ summary/transcript I did (omg the hours...) , which has a nice section with comments about the Aero problems / changes between 1.0 / 1.0.1.

> 
> On the contrary, it concerns the development of KSP (albeit on another platform) and it's definitely the most noteworthy bit of news this week ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So that is prove that PS4 version development will affect the development of the PC version.

Late to the thread, however ...

1. Congrats on the deal.

2. I realize that you guys are excited about what this means for you, but C'mon, this truly isn't a Devnote, it's an announcement, and as such should not be here but in the proper thread.

Oh and Funken - I can play on my couch if inclined, off my media center PC attached to a 47" Flat Screen, 5.1 sound hehehe .... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I came here to read dev notes and chew bubble gum.

And I'm all out of dev notes...

On a more serious note: Congrats, Squad. 

And hopefully this means the devs HAVE to start optimizing for lower end hardware. Or maybe PS4 will just get a nerfed version.

One man's troll post is another man's wake-up call for fanboys.

They had nothing else to talk about. 1.0.3 patch is in testing, three developers returned from two-week vacations (and thus the previous devnotes were titled "Slow News Day.") We have no idea if PS4 port will result in "big cash" - Squad is doing a reasonable thing by working with another company to maintain the port, so that the main developers can concentrate on core features. 

Squad needs to seek new sources of income to grow KSP features (or complete them, if you are of that view) - folks who've already bought KSP... our one time contribution has been made. [This post](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3a4vca/discussion_everybody_chill_out/) by a player on Reddit goes into greater detail.

[The last word on Multiplayer (May 30)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123613-Squadcast-Summary-%282015-05-30%29-Mu-Joins-In%21) was that once 1.0.3 patch is out the door, HarvesteR will be spending more of his time on it, and Mu will take over the majority of KSP core features development.

We're not against expanding; we're against the lack of detailed development information in this devnote and not finishing the game before expanding to console. SQUAD will have to port updates to one more system, most likely doubling the time taken to make an update.

What bothers me is not the porting to PS4...

What bothers me is the fact they are porting it before fixing the bugs the game still have...

Like the Ladder bug, where you cannot retract or extend it on editors when you load a craft file... that is still around since KSP 0.24...

and this is just one of the many bugs the game still have... they released the game (1.0) with bugs... And I'm sure they will port it with bugs...

And console ppl don't accept bugs in games the same way pc ppl does...

My biggest concern is that they're talking about UI changes. Granted that there are some aspects of the UI (PC version, I could care less about a console version, I've never owned a console and probably never will.) that need attention but what I don't want to see even almost happening is console style UI showing up in the PC version. Currently KSP uses MOST of the PC keyboard. I don't even want to imagine trying to do stuff in KSP with anything even remotely resembling a console style UI.

So long as the PC version keeps it's much more capable keyboard & mouse centric UI perhaps with, omg, more information (customizeable KER style data readouts anyone?) then great.

The only thing I hope for from a console version is that it not take away from the PC version.
